title: Cumberland Hospital security overhaul after three deaths | 7NEWS
description: Cumberland Hospital has undergone a major management shake-up following two patient escapes that allegedly led to three deaths. An independent team of health experts will now oversee the troubled psychiatric hospital, with security staff increased from four to six plus a supervisor. A third patient who failed to return from approved leave has been brought back by police, while a formal review examines patient care, security protocols and abscondment management ahead of the hospital's closure at the end of next year. title: Maylands couple locked out of defect-riddled home | 7NEWS
description: A Maylands couple claims their home construction has become a nightmare, with their builder, Sovereign Building Company, locking them out of an unfinished property riddled with defects. Building reports have identified major structural issues including incorrectly strapped roof frames, substandard brickwork, walls out of level, and waterproofing not meeting Australian standards. Building and Energy issued a directive in August to fix 49 defects within 70 days, but almost none have been addressed despite the deadline expiring. title: Mullewa gunman's car found after seven weeks | 7NEWS
description: Kenneth Giles, a 58-year-old gunman wanted for shooting his partner Tanya Moran in the hand on January 7, has been on the run for seven weeks from the Midwest town of Mullewa. His abandoned Nissan Patrol was discovered 40 kilometres northeast of his home near Hackett Creek, containing alcohol and medication but no firearms or survival supplies. Police continue their search despite heavy rain from Cyclone Mitchell washing away potential tracks, and have not ruled out the possibility that someone may be assisting him. title: Calls to use fatal crash footage to educate drivers | 7NEWS
description: Dr Reece Belling, a prominent obstetrician, was sentenced to 10.5 years in prison for killing 24-year-old Elizabeth Pearce and severely injuring Uber driver Mohamed Usman while driving drunk and enraged through suburban streets. Dashcam footage from Belling's Jaguar, released by the court during sentencing, captured seven minutes of dangerous driving before the fatal crash. The video's release has sparked debate about using it as an educational tool for young drivers and prompted calls to review Western Australia's driving offence penalties.
